description:
Intermediate week with speed and recovery long session.

Focus on giving the body a slightly calmer training and getting in short intervals (without speed that risks any damage). The feeling of long workouts is of course good to maintain - but the coach intends to make it shorter this year so you can recharge for the following week's longest long workouts

Easy extra run that really is extra. Of course gives good effect with tomorrow's run; but run no injury or overtraining limits now to get this run. Only for those of you who feel like you're soaking up all the training right now! Prioritize tomorrow...

You recognize the short intervals. The last time where you run 15 pieces of 200 meters.

Target slightly faster than the last time if you have a good day. So a little under 4.00 pace and thus under 48 seconds per 200 meters.

We keep the rest at 45s between intervals and 90 s between series.

Float, but still a little pressure in the step on the last series. Allow yourself to be tired....if you have an ok day!

Easy extra run that really is extra. Of course gives good effect with tomorrow's run; but run no injury or overtraining limits now to get this run. Only for those of you who feel like you're soaking up all the training right now! Prioritize tomorrow...

The program breaks off with a slightly shorter long session. If a long session can feel short?

The session maintains your long session feeling, but hopefully gives the body a chance to absorb all the training.

Coach Szalkai wants this slightly shorter long session to now give you a small "buffer" both mentally and physically before the upcoming last tough part of the program - before the tapering starts towards the marathon, which is now only less than 4 weeks away.

So calm base speed and a little shorter, but of course with the usual long-run advice where drink/energy is included and that you be careful after the session with dry clothes and new energy in so you don't open up to catching an unnecessary cold now!
